entries.title: GOP-led House creates a new committee to tackle threats from China, its first big bipartisan win
entries.description: The overwhelming 365-65 vote to create the China committee gave House Speaker Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., a genuine bipartisan victory.

entries.title: Wells Fargo, once the No. 1 player in mortgages, is stepping back from the housing market
entries.description: It's the latest, and perhaps most significant, strategic shift that CEO Charlie Scharf has undertaken since joining Wells Fargo in late 2019.

entries.title: FTX's venture backers included Patriots owner Robert Kraft and billionaire Paul Tudor Jones, new filings show
entries.description: FTX's roster of big-name backers included Paul Tudor Jones and Robert Kraft as well as Tom Brady and Gisele Bündchen.

entries.title: Apple's App Store growth is slowing down, latest figure shows
entries.description: This year's disclosure suggests that Apple's App Store growth has plateaued.

entries.title: Tesla, Uber, Amazon, Starbucks: The 2023 Just 100 list biggest gainers, losers and surprises
entries.description: On the 2023 Just 100 list, Tesla makes progress, Uber's gig takes a big drop, and union issues can't stop Starbucks, Amazon from getting high worker marks.

entries.title: This simple graph shows why we need to study ways of reflecting sunlight to cool the Earth
entries.description: As part of the most recent assessment report about the ozone layer, scientists say that stratospheric aerosol injection needs to be researched internationally.

entries.title: Powell reiterates Fed is not going to become a 'climate policymaker'
entries.description: Powell said that climate change is not a main consideration for the Fed when developing monetary policy.

entries.title: Elon Musk's $182 billion net worth drop breaks Guinness World Record
entries.description: Musk's loss shattered the previously existing world record: a $58.6 billion loss by Japanese investor Masayoshi Son in 2000.

entries.title: Bed Bath & Beyond lays off more employees as it fights to survive
entries.description: Bed Bath & Beyond is cutting jobs and is at risk of bankruptcy.

entries.title: 'Top Gun: Maverick' and Disney were the box office leaders in an otherwise soft 2022
entries.description: While Paramount's "Top Gun: Maverick" topped the charts as the highest-grossing film of the year, Disney is the studio that wears the 2022 box office crown.

entries.title: Bed Bath & Beyond reports wider-than-expected loss as possible bankruptcy looms
entries.description: Days after Bed Bath warned of potential bankruptcy, it reported negative operating cash flow for the third quarter and ballooning net losses.

entries.title: Powell stresses need for Fed's political independence while tackling inflation
entries.description: The central bank leader noted that stabilizing prices requires making tough decisions that can be unpopular politically.

entries.title: Amazon plans to close three UK warehouses, impacting 1,200 workers
entries.description: Amazon is considering closing three sites in England and in Scotland in a move union reps criticize despite the company's pledges of alternative jobs.

entries.title: Microsoft reportedly plans to invest $10 billion in creator of buzzy A.I. tool ChatGPT
entries.description: A bet on ChatGPT could help Microsoft boost its efforts in web search, a market dominated by Google.

entries.title: Gold trades near 8-month high and analysts expect its rise to continue
entries.description: Gold notched an 8-month intraday high on Monday as the precious metal's strong start to 2023 continued, buoyed by lower yields and a weaker dollar.

entries.title: Coinbase to slash 20% of workforce in second major round of job cuts
entries.description: CEO Brian Armstrong pointed to more pressure on the crypto sector thanks to "unscrupulous actors in the industry."

entries.title: Russia risks becoming a failed state in the next 10 years, analysts say
entries.description: Russia as we know it may not survive the coming decade and risks becoming a failed state as it pursues its costly Ukraine war, global analysts believe.

entries.title: 'Quick and dirty': France's Macron expected to push through pension reforms after years of pushback
entries.description: France's legal retirement age is currently 62 — lower than many developed markets, including much of Europe and the U.S.

entries.title: Chinese travelers say new restrictions are 'unfair' — but they're angry at some countries more than others
entries.description: Some Chinese travelers say they're not going to South Korea and Japan — not because they're boycotting them, but because they're being blocked from entering.

entries.title: U.S. tax credits could benefit global automakers — but Europe wants more
entries.description: The European Union is still not completely satisfied with recent concessions from Washington on its historic set of green energy subsidies.

entries.title: Federal prosecutor reviewing classified documents found at former Biden office
entries.description: A lawyer for President Joe Biden said the documents were found in Biden's former office months after the FBI raided Donald Trump's Florida home.

entries.title: Mainland Chinese citizens are eager to travel — for the West's mRNA Covid vaccines
entries.description: Mainland China has reopened its borders, and citizens eager to travel are booking not just flight tickets, but also vaccination appointments.

entries.title: Virgin Orbit stock plummets after failure of its first UK rocket launch
entries.description: Virgin Orbit stock fell in trading on Monday evening, after the company confirmed that its first launch out of the United Kingdom failed to reach orbit.
